We believe in free access to music, but also a fair music industry where artists and others are paid for their work and services. 

Revenue that we make from advertising allows us to pay royalties to the artists, so if you are listening for free you will need to allow ads to cover the costs of your listening.

Review Content: With the 2019 August release the app just got more awkward.   Not only is navigating to the playlists very cumbersome, exiting the app is now harder .   Instead of adding the one click close that I've repeatedly asked to be added., NOW, instead of 3 clicks to close the app, you have to hit the Home button in the upper left, CLICK SETTINGS  and THEN SCROLL ALL THE WAY DOWN THE PAGE to EXIT APP.   The app has gone backwards in my opinion.  I love digitally imported but for a very progressive selection of music I can't understand why they can't get the simple parts of the technology designed better as this is the only interface we have to use on our phones to listen in the car, earbuds, etc.     This needs to be a priority fix.     If it weren't for the complex navigation I'd give this more STARS, but as much as I listen I have to go through an unnecessary amount of clicks to navigate, especially to close it.   I have also had a lot of connectivity issues and freeze ups.  If the developer was as concerned about the bugs and fixes as they are about changing the icon, (TWICE LATELY) it would be better.  Function is always more important than pretty.
Reply Content: Thanks, we will forward this feedback to the dev team for consideration!

Reply Content: Hi there! We apologize for any inconvenience we caused. We had a system-wide outage and everything is back up and running now. Please, let us know if you still have any issues.

Review Content: This and other companion apps (Classical Radio etc.) now play nothing on my Samsung Galaxy Tab A tablets, both current and previous generations, and crash after about 30 seconds. Same thing on my Samsung Galaxy S9 phone. The apps worked fine with these tablets and phone until recent upgrades. I love Jazz Radio, but after subscribing for many years I will not be renewing if this is not resolved. What's the point in paying for a product I can no longer use?
Reply Content: Thanks for your feedback David. Please try the following: clear our app cache, delete the app, restart the device, reinstall the app. If the crash issues continue, please reach back to us with some additional details about when and how the app crashed. Do it on one app, and we can go from there :) Worry not, we will sort it out.

Review Content: Scammers. If you try a free month of Premium, there is NO WAY of cancelling before you are charged $80 . There is no way to cancel your subscription from Google Play or the Jazz Radio website.
Reply Content: Hey there, thanks for reaching out. You can cancel your auto-renewal at any time, via Google Play Store. Please reach out to our support team at support@jazzradio.com for assistance with the cancellation process of your Trial subscription.

Review Content: Great app, which is severely let down by lack of integration into Android Auto. Same goes for the sister apps. I only want to use this in my car, which is totally unfeasible without Android Auto support. Here's an idea, why not add Auto support and have it as an up-sells for subscribers like myself? At the moment, I'm seriously considering cancelling my subscription, because there really is no justification for not supporting Android Auto these days. Practically all of your competitors do, so come on already!
Reply Content: Hey there, we are happy to report that the Android Auto support is out! Give it a try!

Review Content: Ironically I just wrote a similar review for another music app.  Like that one this one also neglects to tell you you have to sign up first with your personal info before you get a chance to see how it works & what it offers.  It may be the the best music app ever made but if so why not let us see what it's about before you demand our info in a signup.  Most other music apps don't play that game.  I'll signup if there are additional benefits but come on...  Want me to sign up without showing me what you got ?  No thanks . . .
Reply Content: Hey there, sorry to hear that. We do offer guest experience on our website, but application works differently. In order to comply with our licencing we need to request at least a free membership for the mobile app.

This app can't use your phone's built in FM tuner despite it's description, it just streams audio from the internet. Some of the streams happen to be transmitted by media companies that own real FM stations, but the streaming audio isn't the same as the broadcasted FM audio. For example, my local sports station transmits games over the air, but not over the internet. This app can't tune into those games.

Review Content: A frustrating experience. I can record myself using my phone and the audio quality is very good. The frustration comes when my co-host and I try to connect remotely. I appreciate they could be going through issues with COVID-19, but any responsible company would notify their users if they were aware of a major bug like this.

Not a good selection of gospel music. I will be deleting.

Review Content: Online radio, yes. FM radio, no. Update: The name of the app clearly says FM RADIO. That is NOT FM radio. FM radio is OFFLINE radio. Change the name and please stop with the description nonsense. The name is clearly misleading. And it's done on purpose, since you know how many people are looking for an actual FM radio. Again, as long as it requires an internet connection, that is NOT FM radio. So the name has nothing to do with the product. Hence the rating. Change the app's NAME to Online Radio only, and I'll change my rating.
Reply Content:
Dear user,
Thanks for your feedback.
We are very explicit saying in our descriptions that we are not an offline radio.
Our apps use Internet waves (longer reach) and you can listen to stations from all over the world. This means you need an Internet connection for this.You can use it just with wifi if you wish.
Best,
Support Team

No FM stereo. My phone's built-in FM radio app (Moto g7 power) supports FM stereo. I am preferably looking for an app with a stereo/mono switch (sometimes mono sounds clearer on weak stations), and this app does not have one (it ALWAYS plays in mono). While the app works, it has no value, as I am not going to listen to music in mono all the time.

Wow! Just had Bluetooth headphones for Christmas to see if it works on this app. Yet what a bummer, when I click on any FM station, I get a notification saying that "your headphones are antenna. Little that I know, that in a course of a year, this app rendered itself useless. No point in keeping it.

"NextRadio offers two ways to listen to live, local FM Radio. If your device has the FM receiver chip activated, you will be able to listen to local, terrestrial FM radio ..." -- maybe, but in the modern corporate way, NextRadio doesn't provide any information which might be characterized as negative -- like whether your device can receive FM (contrary to the implication of the quote, many devices simply do not have one to activate) or not.  No, users just have to infer that because no tuner is visible or findable through the interface, their device either has no FM tuner (or it isn't "activated") -- "Settings"?  No, the app lets drop not so much as a hint about whether there's a tuner in your device or not.  All the people pushing streaming apps are determined to misrepresent them as radio apps instead, which makes it about impossible to find actual tuners.

Reply Content: Thanks for posting! When songs are skipping, it is often because 1) that station's server has recently been reset or 2) the internet isn't filling the audio buffer fast enough. Usually these issues are resolved with faster internet, changing the wifi settings on your device, or resolve on their own after the server resets. Thanks for the feedback!

The app stop's playing if the screen is off and will not play in the background
Reply Content: Thanks for posting! For devices on newer OS, the app stops when the Power Saving mode is ON and the screen goes dark. To fix, go to device Settings - Battery - POWER SAVING OFF. On some devices, the path may be: Settings - Device Maintenance - Battery - Power Saving. If this doesn't work, check that your Wifi stays on while the device is asleep.

Review Content: Lots of radio stations around! Heart has been in my life for many years! But after their recent axing of all the local radio staff, I just can't stomach this station any longer! This app used to be awsome for when driving because with just one press of a button and you were listening to your favourite heart station. Now it is several stages to get to your local station including an intrusive 10 second video advert upon opening the app. Heart play too many adverts as it is without adding a video advert to watch before you can listen. Please put it back to the way it was or I will have to switch to magic. Update: Now I can't turn the app off. If you want the music to turn off you have to press the music stop button. If you press the phones back button the app totally closes down but still plays music. The only way to to turn it off is to reopen the app all over again and press the music stop button. Very very dangerous app to use when driving. I thought the last update was bad but now they've made it worse. Will be deleting as I mainly use in car via my Bluetooth

Review Content: app itself is great you can listen to several genres of radio under the global banner, unfortunately global are only interested in making money, like so many i used to tune in for the locally hosted heart breakfast shows which had relatable funny and joyful content, now im forced to find better local stations as i couldnt give a tosh about the laughing imbeciles on the now national breakfast show the really annoying thing about heart is the non stop adverts to text in through every show dismal!

Couldnt get any worse, music ends after few seconds of starting, a lot of errors every now and then, liking a song doesnt make a difference, it doesnt create a custom playlist, the startup gets stuck and all u see is the loading sign for ever... You'd terminate it, and out of the blue, it'll start up!! And it stops out of no where!! Poorly made

Uninstalled. Kept defaulting to London, which I suppose is because they planned to axe local stations all along. I'll miss Joel and Lorna!! Also how many paid reviews does this have? No one is that excited about a radio station. It won't help you win the ¬£30k tripple play!

They moved the most popular radio pairing to a later slot when most people didnt want that. Myself and my fiance loved listening in the car to Dixie and Emma in a morning. Shame on you for making decisions without considering your listeners!! I will be boycotting the station, like many others no doubt!!

app can be glitchy with too many adds, and global just got rid of local breakfast radio shows and presenters. bad app and bad company with nothing worth listening too, not worth the space it takes up on your phone. bring back local radio.
Keeps cutting off every 2-3 minutes when screen closed. Have had to uninstall and install again

so disappointed that Tom nicola and Jack are no more .... local radio station and their presenters are so important ... but unfortunately it's all down to money and it would seem that you think the only thing that can keep listeners are big money comps .... breakfast show is just so awful and the music is repeated way to much it would seem you only have a repertoire of about 5 artists and songs !! so now cant keep listening as the great presentrs made up for that ... over to MORE radio for me .

Unfortunately this app isn't working for me at all. It constantly stops and starts, then totally stops playing the radio. It says no internet connection, but there is! missing Emma and Dixie on a morning.

It's a poorly designed app to begin with - way to busy; headache inducing! - but when a subscriber cant even listen to a complete hour, what's the point?

Edit: The latest update of the app (1/7) has NOT fixed issues I am seeing. 1 star rating is still valid. If I didn't love Rush's show, I wouldn't go near this app. By far the worst performing app on my Galaxy S9. Rush should be embarrassed to have such a low quality product with his name on it. 1 Example: Select 'Podcasts' from the menu and it will take a really long time to respond. Many times it takes so long a message pops up saying the app is not responding.

It keeps stopping every few minutes, I've emailed a few times and not received a response. I pay for this subscription and I have not received any support. This is completely unacceptable. podcast audio would quit after 10 min. Problems with this app are well documented. I think I have a fix but still rate one star due to no response from developer. Problem might be related to hidden Android battery optimization feature. To keep Rush Podcast audio from stopping after 10 min. Android Pie Galaxy S9, S10,and Note 10. Settings> apps> Rush> optimize battery usage> defaults to apps not optimized change to All in drop down menu now you will see all apps that have battery optimization turned on or off. Scroll down to Rush and turn off. Hope this helps after doing this was able to listen to 30 min Podcast without stopping even with screen asleep. I expect better customer service from Rush I will not be renewing my 24/7 subscription.

I listen to rush daily. But this app is absolute garbage! I cannot listen with my screen off! It stops audio! If I get a call it starts the podcast over! Now, after 6 months of enduring this hassle, my app doesn't work at all! I've uninstalled and force stopped and cheesemonger cache and data. I've emailed the app support staff so many times and they have no solution and could cater less about the horrible experience I've had. I cannot believe this. This app is worthless on my Samsung Note 9. Audio stops every couple minutes and eventually the app crashes. I've just quit using it. I haven't deleted it (yet) hoping for an update that will fix it. Love Rush, but this app is barely usable, and it hasn't been updated since Dec 2018. As other reviewers have stated, audio periodically stops. It also kicks my phone off my car's Bluetooth system and I can't get my phone reconnected until I restart the car. No other app does this.

After attempting for a full year to get this app to work, I cannot justify rewing. The new app stops about every 10 minutes. I requested help but never received a response. I can't stop what I'm doing every 10 minutes to start the app again so missed most episodes. I did not renew.

Ok, first of all, I this has nothing to do with Rush, but this app is garbage. It may work for Apple iPhone users, but ever the update, this hasn't worked on my phone. It will work for a few minutes, but will shut down randomly. Please fix this for Android users! üò©
Took forever and now I have no access to the Maharushie? FIX IT!!!

I love Rush but the latest update caused the audio to stop working. It has been a bit buggy in the past but I was fine with it because I was able to listen to his show when I was able to instead of having to tune in between 12 and 3. But now I can't get audio.

I've been a 24/7 member for years, & this app has been awful the whole time. It randomly stops, & I have to go find my place. Another gripe is that the archived shows are listed in a way that doesn't allow easy playback. I like to listen to the whole week on the weekend. It will play hour 1, 2, 3... but then goes to an older show. It would be more convenient if newer shows were listed first (3, 2, 1 pattern) so I could start on Monday & it would play through oldest to the newest show on Friday.
The app doesn't run well on my razr. If I don't touch the phone and it auto locks, I have to start the program over. No way to pause it and come back to where I was if I get called away for a while.
The play back ALWAYS stops and resets or the entire app stops and app needs to be reopened. It's only good for reading the transcripts. The playback of shows is not even worth it through the app.

Love Rush and listen every day via the app. It looks great. It is just plain awful in terms of performance. Maybe it's my phone but I doubt it. The screen must always be on or it stops playing shortly after the screen turns off. I typically listen on demand and there is literally no buffer. So you better have a perfect connection or it's buffering or starting over. At random times when I start it, I have to re enter my login info which is really annoying when I'm in the car. I'm willing to suffer with this horrific app because the content is, as we know, top notch. And Rush has said many times, if the content is there, people will do whatever they can to access it. He's right.

love Rush. hate the app. I mainly listen to Rush show on the app. First horrible problem. if I pause the app's player to eat or answer a phone call, most of the time I lose my place and have to go back to the beginning of the podcast. Maddening. Second, I can't speed the podcast play speed. Rush speaks so clearly that I can play him back at 1.5 speed (faster) and listen to him so much better. Rush's show is 5 stars. his app is 1 star.
Keeps stopping in middle of play. Will shut off when the phone screen rests. Literally cuts out for no reason. The only time it works consistently is when charging.
Rush is awesome, this app is not. Crashes all the time and audio stops when phone sleeps regardless of phone settings.

I have an Android Nexus 6P. App freezes often. Then restarts only from the beginning. I am forced to jump forward 15 seconds at a time. When watching video and I receive a phone call the video must be restarted from the beginning. Rush app allows me to control volume, but does not allow the volume level to be visually displayed. I've listened to Rush for 29 + years. I like Rush. Unfortunately his app is lousy.

Like most, I love Rush and will always listen.  Having said that, the Android 24/7 app is horrendous.  I mainly use it to listen to episodes that I missed.  The broadcast will restart from the beginning the minute I leave a WiFi coverage;  It will stop playing if the screen turns off; it will not hold it's place if I stop/pause it even for a short period of time; and, sometimes just stops and restarts without any explanation.  I am an Android guy and always will be.  I also pay for this service.  When I contacted support, I got the canned answers of clearing cache, reinstalling, etc.  When that did not work, I got "There is a known issue that we are working on."  Well, that was quite a while ago.  Come on guys, please take care of this!

Android users beware! I love the content here but if your device is not Apple you may as well just move along and save yourself the frustration and some money. This app constantly crashes and must be restarted several times over the course of an hour of the show. This is especially frustrating while driving or working. I'm embarrassed for Rush, I expected better.

I love Rush. Been a subscriber for years. The previous app was pretty darn good. Rush keeps bragging about the new app but honestly I think it's awful. never downloads, just spins and spins. logs you off all the time and have to log back on while listening. cant delete already downloaded pods. in the year had to reload it 4xs. i know im not the only one. only reason it gets grear reviews is becouse of his name. 1/25/2919. I listened to Rush since early 90s and really wanted to have access to the podcast. However the app is painful to use. It looks like it was created by a college freshman designer who crammed every flashy effect and feature they could think of into it. End result is a buggy unusable pile of steamy goo that attempts to do many things but fails at all of them. It is especially inept at letting you listen to Rush. I do not want a portal to the website that pukes all available content at me. I want an audio player that is not a danger to myself or others when I try to control a podcast with it. Please, just hire one of the many podcast developers available in the store and have them design a functional UI for you. Until then, I'll have to stay away.

I love Rush! 24/7 sub. Been a Ditto Head since 2001 when I was 19. I like the app, but it CRASHES ALL THE TIME! I hate the tech support team. But it still crashes, and no one cares to listen. so 5 stars for Rush, 0 stars for the app & 0 stars for the support team.

The one star is for the app, not Rush. I honestly hate this app. I love Rush, but I can't understand why he cant get good people to work on his app! It logs you off often. Password reset is not a simple email with a link. You have to send customer support an email, and they'll get back to you eventually. Terrible Terrible Terrible! I used to get Rush's show on a podcast app that auto downloaded to the playlist I wanted and I didn't have to do anything except wait until the show was available. This is sad because I don't necessarily always have an internet connection. Also, it still crashes every 15 minutes. Listening to Rush has become so difficult. It makes me very sad.

Not sure what happened. Only know an update was done a few days ago & it completely wiped out my app from my home screen. Tried to reinstall & get told it's already installed. Cant see it use it or find it on my Galaxy J3.. How do I get this fixed or get my money back?

Tons of issues. Have tried this app on my Galaxy S9+, Galaxy S8, Galaxy S6, & DroidMotoZ. Audio pauses when phone is unplugged & screen is off. Constant crashes when multitasking or screen is locked. Interestingly, the app works great on my iPhone 5s. So now I use hotspot from Galaxy S9 & carry two devices

Worst app I have ever used. When I open it back up I have to log in again!! What a PIA!! If it does start playing again after reconnecting in the truck it doesn't remember where it left off and replays the whole hour again!!

This app is twice the cost of Spotify but lacks basic features such as the ability to arrange songs within a playlist by title or artist. You can't search for a song within your playlist. When you take into account that you can't arrange your songs alphabetically within the playlist on Tidal you will be looking for that song for some time! Review Content: USELESS!.... Not user-friendly at all.. You cannot hear anything even for a trial u still need to hit their subscription package... I would've preferred for them to give me the 4 months for $4 but their customer service sucks although the situation was explained.

Review Content: Top notch sound quality but; -there is too much bug in the app -can not control what you listen (there is no feature like Spotify connect) -can not share to Instagram same artwork for every song -support team is doing their best but it's take time for example i'm waiting 3 weeks for to solve that Instagram issue. -sad to experience these problems but great sound quality :)
Music is great the app is garbage. Its a bunch of half loaded screens and every time you open the app it's just a blank black screen with a play button. Please make it more stable and consistent.

Review Content: Terrible selection of stations unless you want every genre hip-hopified. Even the songs within stations are of poor selection. Review Content: Ransom Ware.. say you get free trial then start trying to charging my card hit it 3 or 4 times I had it frozen. That was before the trial period was up and they say that once they charge you there are no refunds. CROOKS; BE CAREFULL

This app keeps cutting my music off. I can't get thru 1 whole song before it changes to another song and then will not play that whole song either. I am rather irritated for paying 10 bucks a month for skipping songs

Review Content: used to be 3 stars for me. Audio quality is great, however here are my issues: Metallica? until recently Tool not available. Also even when you "download" music for offline streaming takes music and streams. So if you have no data coverage you have to manually "go offline ". Last update completely broke it, both on Laptop, Windows 10, and LG Stylo, Android 7.0. All playlists are gone, all downloaded songs gone. Guess I'll go back to Spotify. Never had this issue with them. A shame, I'll miss Tidal Hi-Fi and Master qualities. Roll back to last update, Tidal!

They have removed the gesture swipe left/right for suggestions and playlist in the past but they fixed it only to remove it again. Tidal UI/ UX need to get their act together. Buttons aren't it.

We are working hard to resolve the current problems with audio loss as quickly as possible.

How do I leave streams and how do I choose and search
Reply Content: You can leave a stream by pressing the down arrow on the top right corner of the LIVE, then the "x" on the bottom right. To search, press the magnifying glass icon on the home screen! If you have any other questions, let us know at support@spooncast.net.

Reply Content: Sorry you're experience difficulties loading Spoon! Please email support@spooncast.net so we can get to the bottom of this.

Review Content: Clearly some kind of scam. Don't bother with this app. The only notifications it ever sent me were scam advertisements for free iPhones. Seriously disappointing, it doesn't even make sense.
Reply Content: Not a scam - check out our other reviews if you're unsure! We are a voice live stream app where you can talk or make music, interact with listeners, and receive donations from fans. And it's true -- we are giving away an iPhone to encourage people to download the app and follow us on social media!

Already paid for the pro version years ago, then , a one-time fee. Now the benefit is rolled back, why would I bother subscribing for a limited version of what I already had. I understand developers need to get paid, but there are no significant incentives to do so, especially without anything like original content.

They continue to harass you with advertisements in the paid version. The banners go away but you still get the even more annoying full page things you have to dismiss to continue. They've been increasing injected advertisements in the podcasts I listen to as well so I'm not really sure I understand the point of this pro version. I don't use it enough to make their premium subscription pricing make any kind of sense especially given the podcasts I listen to aren't really anything to do with them. What was once a pretty nice app is basically now just a scam to squeeze money for next to nothing out of us.

Paid for premium version to simply listen to radio as and when I'd like to, as the free version was full of ads. Now this version that I paid for is full of ads, and as the last straw leading me to uninstall it - this app that I rarely use keeps appearing in my notifications, even if I force stop it (I don't like the lack of control of modern OSs, and don't buy the automatic nature being more efficient, based on my experience). Shame, as this used to be an app that I would recommend, no more :(

I can no longer recommend TuneIn Pro. I bought this while the product allowed ad-free, recordable, internet radio. Now all of a sudden my $5-$10 that I spent for the product is just as good as the free edition? For this I'd rather have a refund that or I want my ad free radio back instead of being told that the terms of agreement that I bought this product is no longer valid and it can be changed as they please.

This app has gone downhill. I rarely use it anymore. Whenever I'm listening to a station it will only play for a short time (even while manually recording) and then turn off, for whatever reason. You can no longer schedule recordings, that I used to be able to record all the time. When selecting a recording time to save it to, it just shows the current time, never actually saving to your selected time. Apparently the developer is aware of this issue but hasn't fix this, for months now.

For years a great app with minimal problems, but the last few days have been awful. It will only play for a couple of minutes, then shuts off. This is annoying and makes it impossible to listen to the radio without holding it in your hand to keep turning it back on. Please fix this problem. If you want people to quit using it, you're on your way to success. If profits are down (in Pro) run more ads, we don't want to hear a lot of them, but it's a small sacrifice to enjoy your favorite programs.

Like so many others, I paid for TuneIn Pro years ago. Not the Pro users fault the app didn't attract enough new customers to realize the devs dreams of monetary gain. They use money we paid to advance their product, then instead of grandfathering the paying customers in, they slap us in the face with incessant nagging upgrade ads, poor service, and waning content. Great business plan.

Reply Content: Hello Robert! Sorry to hear about the trouble you're having. Please shoot us an email at support@tunein.com and we'd love to take a look for you. Most issues can be resolved with the help of TuneIn's customer support. We look forward to hearing from you - thanks for your time!

Review Content: After using for TuneIn Radio for years on my now dead Samsung Galaxy S5 I downloaded the app onto my new Nokia 7.1; all channels now have annoying crackling sounds. I've tried reinstalling but the problem remains. None of the other internet radio apps I've downloaded since have this problem.

For everyone moaning about the app shutting itself off after a few minutes YOU NEED TO ALLOW BACKGROUND ACTIVITY in the app settings. But this is by far the latest version's biggest problem - BATTERY DRAIN IS NOW CATASTROPHIC. This was never an issue previously SO FIX IT. It's completely unacceptable.

Files just put in a folder on the phone memory (not SD card), with a .pandora extension added. Once located they could be just renamed and viewed. Not even basic encryption. I don't know why people are threatening lawsuits over not being able to retrieve their photos - just hunt around the device memory for the pandora folder, drop the .pandora extension, and it doesn't matter if you know the password or not. Totally insecure, and if you have a sizeable collection then you'll quickly run out of device memory as well.

Terrible app. Doesn't connect to my brand new Bose headphones. Bose connect app is much better, I would use that but it won't allow me to connect because it says this app is much better ü§î. The headphones work far better if this app is NOT installed, even though it suggests downloading it immediately. Sound quality and switching between devices is a constant struggle, and most times the app cannot connect to the headphones at all. Love the headphones, don't waste your time on this app.

The headphones are excellent but this app is soooooo poorly done. It never connects, though the headphone connect everytime to the device you have to reconnect the app. The app causes issues with connection and can only be used if you give it full locations access. Unable to connect to my Boss SoundLink. Don't advertise it as "all Bose products" if you're unable to connect with ALL Bose products.

App did work fine, But now keeps asking for location permission when opened. I have granted it but the app still "thinks" it has not got it. Gives me warning I can not add any other bose items :-( At least I know of the bug before I invest in any new bose items. Feed back via the support function.... No response in about a week.
Recent update seems to have broken it. Does not switch or show proper status. Have to restart app for every other action.

I had an interruption of my internet service due an outage in my area 2 weeks ago. Once the service was restored, I was able to reconnect all of my devices except my Bose Home Speaker 500. The screen on the speaker keeps showing the Wi-Fi is diabled. This speaker costs entirely too much money to suddenly stop working properly. The only thing it will do is connect to other devices via bluetooth. I'm extremely upset and disappointed.

This app provides no benefit to only headphone users. No equaliser, basically only cycles through ANC levels, which you can do on your headphones anyway. Not related to the app - but still a Bose product: the 700 headphones.. To switch off ANC you have to open the app, connect your headphones and switch off ANC in the app? Why on earth would this not be an option on the actual headphones? The only reason I use the app is to connect my headphones and toggle ANC on or off
It is a very bad experience to use the app, i do regret i bought...it does not keep the connection to headset, but they are connected throug bluetooth...so dissapointing...

This app doesn't like to connect with my Bose Headphones because the connection keeps being rejected. I wanted to give this a five star, but i Knew this was critical for Bose to correct on. This is actually a five star, but one star shows that how i want this to develop. Please fix up the rejection, by giving us an update. I love my headphones, but the app is certainly not acceptable.

Headphones connect to the phone fine but are available to be used in the app at most 30% of the time. When they become unable to connect in app the only way to fix is to completely unpair, forget from the phone, clear the entire Bluetooth list from the headphones, and delete them from the app. After that, it still takes 20-30 connection attempts for the app to register the headphones again. Please fix your in app connection, the connection to the phone is fine the problem lies with this software

The app underwent update several months ago and since the update, I have been unable to connect via Android devices. Also, Spotify is the only music app I can play music directly to speaker, therefore I cannot listen to any other stations with Pandora or Amazon aside from my presets on the actual speaker. I have used a sibling's iPhone to connect to my Bose Home 500 Speaker to make any changes to presets but otherwise I cannot access the app at all on my own Android devices.

As usual a company that makes great hardware drops the ball on the essential software portion of the product. So far I love my Bose 700 headphones but I HATE the app. The headphones will be connected via Bluetooth and playing awesome sound while the app reports that it can't connect and I should press the button until the headphones say 'ready to connect to another device'. That's pretty pathetic. How did that make it through QA? Edit: They work perfectly with Google Asst and everything now that they're disconnected from the App. I just connected Bluetooth and a Google Asst notification helped set them up and done. The Bose App and website say I don't have any products but *shrug*

Finally got them to work. Sounds OK. Not the Bose of old. Also, app resets every time you turn off your headphones. It doesn't remember your last settings even though it says it will! Don't waste you money on these. I'm so sorry I did.

Horrible app. It took me unplugging my soundbar multiple times to register...and I've been pulling the plug and re-opening the app for the past 2 hours, just in case the app can be bothered to pick up the bass module. Should have read the other reviews before I purchased. Nothing wrong with the hardware, however the woeful app alone has convinced me to stay away from Bose and go with a competent manufacturer next time.

For the last three weeks couldn't use it all, app crashing when trying to launch. Provided feedback to the team twice, even after their app received an update post Android overall security update. Make sure your phone is not set to stop the LiveXLive app automatically when they are in the background or your screen is off:

Settings > Apps > LiveXLive > Battery > Allow Background Activity is set to ON.

Review Content: I have this app on my laptop and the experience is wonderful. I use my bluetooth headphones on my laptop and it works perfectly. Makes the app really unusable. And I know it's not my headphones or my bluetooth because I've tested other apps while connected and everything works fine.
Reply Content: We are sorry to hear about your problem. This is really strange because we don't do any special handling for Bluetooth headphones. Even when Bluetooth headphones are selected only certain audio processing parameters are changed. Can you please write to boomandroid@globaldelight.com with more details about your problem?

YouTube does not allow removing them. Beware that sometimes you can see ads from other apps that run in the background. Pls double check your other apps too!

Update: 30 seconds tracks problem is completely fixed now please upgrade to the latest version.
Select the download tab in the app. Choose your genre and use the download buttons next to songs to download them. After the download process is completed songs are available to offline listening. You can find downloaded songs also on the Offline tab.

Even after uninstalling, the spam continued. Please do not download or use this app because of its dangers to your device

Dear User,
We apologize for this experience. We would need to speak with you to better understand the problem you encountered. Please contact us at https://fb.me/atmusicplayer so we can help resolve this issue. Thank you.Beware that sometimes you can see ads from other apps that run in the background. Pls double check your other apps too!

Review Content: Yes, I can stream one album at a time, but the whole reason I purchased this was so that I could stream my entire 27,000 song library from Microsoft OneDrive...on random shuffle.  Guess what?  It either doesn't work at all with Android (all of the help tutorials are for the iPhone) or it can't handle very large libraries (though mine is hardly the largest).  And if I could at least create a playlist, that would be acceptable.  But everytime I add songs to the list and tap the playlist, it shows up as empty even though it says there are say, 17 songs in the list.  So I can't even do that.  Getting it to "read the metadata" is probably a critical thing, but when I try to get it to read all 27,000 songs it konks out after less than a minute.  Therefore, I would have to do one album at a time.  They say there is a fix for this, but I will believe it when I actually see it (and can create a playlist that is not EMPTY).  I lost four hours of my life (that I will never get back) struggling with this thing to no avail,  And if the promised update happens and it fixes all my issues, I will retract this review.  PS the update happened and it is now WORSE if that is even possible.

There is a huge bug. The time mark within the some does not always correspond to the actual song. I might be listening to minute 15 and the time will show minute 3. I would like a refund please Edit: sent email as requested

Review Content: Says you can stream from cloud drive free...yet no option exists? Tried pasting a url into the search nothing comes up. Can only play mp3s off my phone...which is native on Android. If the feature exists it's not easy to find I tried everything.
Reply Content: Hi, you need to have audio files on your cloud drive to be able to stream. Please use Add Cloud button on Files tab to connect to cloud drive.

Review Content: Says it is compatible with one drive. Many people have one drive accounts through their school or business, but such accounts are not recognized by this app. You won't be able to log in to those types of accounts, which disappoints me. The app needs to allow such users to be forwarded to the institutional login page for one drive /o365 so they can login properly. I hope this is fixed in next patch, as I would then give the app a good review.
Reply Content: Thank you for feedback. OneDrive for Business is slightly different from OneDrive and is not supported yet.

Review Content: Used to be a great app and worked with no issues for over a year, but now with every update they push the app completely breaks and I can't access my music libraries anymore. Sometimes I have to send them emails for them to get bug fixes in, other times I have to redownload my entire library. Regardless, it's getting extremely annoying and I can't recommend this app until they start releasing stable builds.

This app does NOT perfectly replace the MS Groove app. Firstly, when selecting my Onedrive music folder for scanning, nothing is found (it even said that 0 files were queued for scanning!). As another user said, the folder has to be opened and a track played before it's added to the database, including artwork. Secondly, there is no filter to seperate locally stored music. When switched off, it shows music from BOTH local and online music. Switching it on filters out online music, so only locally stored music is shown, the reverse of what should happen. What the app should do is sign into the online storage provider, choose your music folder, scan it into the database and then select the filter to only show music stored online. That is what the Microsoft Groove app did! EDIT: Developer replied to my review. I used 'scan folder' but that does not show the album art. Album art on all my music is embedded into the music file using MP3Tag. Only time it is imported is if I play a track from the album. Needless to say, it looks like a total mess! With regards to the filter switch comment, then it's not like Groove at all then is it? I could select to display music ONLY from Onedrive in Groove, so saying it's a full replacement for Groove is somewhat misleading. I use my phones built in music play for locally stored music.
Reply Content: Thank you for your comment. To scan music files into database please select "Read songs metadata" from the folder menu (... button). The Offline toggle on top of the screen, when enabled displays only local content, when inactive it displays all content. This is the behavior which most users would expect.

Review Content: Please fix this app! When it works I like this player for its ability to stream FLAC files from Google Drive. Has potential but compared to CloudPlayer it lacks features and polish. Scanning of Drive files is flaky and fails unexplainably. Many FLAC files stop playing after a couple seconds. Album covers don't load until played. Can download files for offline use, but does not support sdcard. It may associate albums with multiple artists to the wrong artist. Unusable as is.

I want to like it but it wouldn't even play local media without making me upgrade to pro. As it is, I can't really evaluate the app without paying $6 so it gets a one-star rating. Update: That's...not super helpful. Also, I'd like to be able to evaluate it against my Nextcloud instance as some other players have been so-so or just flat out didn't work. The only way I can do that here would be to buy it and get a refund. I get you wanna be paid for your app, but come on, this is ridiculous.
Reply Content:
The app can play local media without upgrade. You may not see them on Files tab but if you switch to Artists tab you get access to all items stored on your device memory.
You can connect to Nextcloud and play music stored there without paying for upgrade. The upgrade is required if you decide to download the files from Nextcloud for offline use.

Review Content: This app does not deliver. As an Editors' Choice app I was intrigued and downloaded it. It seemed promising as a universal EQ I could use with any music player. However, this app, while attractive looking with a smooth UI, does not deliver any (noticeable/at all?) EQing. The free option allows for two presets - a flat profile you can fiddle with and the "Dance" preset. Switching between the two profiles led to no change. Disappointing. Also followed dev advice in comments, nothing worked. (based on LG G3)
Reply Content:
Hello,

Other apps may interfere with EQ.
Please go to your device settings, then 'Application Manager', then 'Running', and close all other music apps open.

Now please try again to use EQ.

Reply Content: Hey Ben,  you are streaming the microphone! To stream other apps in full quality you have to "root" your Android as highlighted in title + description. Otherwise AirAudio can only record the microphone. Please be fair and don't rate us bad for this, but send me an e-mail at support@airaudio.eu for help with this :) Kind regards from Germany.

Review Content: 12 sec delay. On Android TV
Reply Content: Hey Jan, the delay is not introduced by AirAudio, but by your receiver. It has to buffer the audio in realtime as it's produced in realtime by your Android. Most receivers do only use a buffer of ~2 seconds. Please contact me via EMAIL at support@airaudio.eu with some details, maybe we can find a workaround. Kind regards.

Review Content: This app is horrendous, made my tv crash and play this loud noise! Do not download!!

Review Content: Doesn't find AirPlay. Nonsense.
Reply Content: Hey there, this issue is often related to a firewall on your Android or eg. if you have multiple access-points. Normally AirPlay-discovery should work well. Can you please try again after rebooting your Android, the Wifi-router and your receiver and contact me at support@airaudio.eu is the problem persists? Pretty sure we can get it working well :)

Review Content: It says my phone is "rooted" and will not let me use the system mode. Sorry not rooted. So I have to hack my phone to use app?
Reply Content: Hey Julia, it's highlighted in the title & description that "root" is required. AirAudio records the internal audio of the Android and is able to stream the audio of _any_ app on your Android. This feature is limited to "system"-apps and not available to "normal" apps. Please be fair and don't rate us bad for this, it's not our fault :-/

Review Content: There is a 5 sec delay why
Reply Content: Hey there, delay (=buffer) is managed by your receiver. The audio is recorded & transmitted in realtime via Wifi. The receiver has to buffer the audio in realtime for a stable playback. For AirPlay this is eg. 2 seconds and more for other receivers. Bluetooth instead uses a low quality to reduce the delay. This is nothing we can change, sorry :-/

Review Content: I installed this app to overcome Apple Music's incredibly stupid decision to not support ChromeCast. I would gladly shell out $20 for this app if it worked seamlessly... which it didn't. Initially I received annoying "This is the demo version of the app" pop-ups..which made it impossible to even sync/play anything properly... Then when I did get the app working.. there were annoying beeps (reminders that this is the unlicensed version) which is okay.. but the developers go a little over the top with it.   Finally, the volume controls are very finicky... and there's some amount of lag between when you take an action on your phone versus how the sound gets affected on your receiver...   I don't know.. I'm going to play with it some more... and look at other options in the mean time... so far... slightly disappointed.  Other than that... very good layout.. and looks like a polished app.  Updates: Nope. Uninstalling it. Has trouble connecting to ChromeCast... continues to bring up a "A Problem Has Occurred" pop-up... and even made my ChromeCast receiver crash...
Reply Content: Hey Ammar, I'm sorry to read about your issues. Would you please contact me at support@airaudio.eu and give it another chance? If you have a ChromeCast v1, then this is a bug with the current firmware and there's a workaround.  Hope you will give it a chance, pretty sure it's worth the effort :) Cheers & kind regards from Germany..

If you have forgotten theses credentials please contact us at bfsupport@charitydynamics.com or click on the forgot password in the login screen of the app. THANK YOU for being a Heart Hero and participating in the Kids Heart Challenge!!

Heart Rate graphs are visible for all users of the paid version of Instant Heart Rate. Please make sure you are running Instant Heart Rate+ and not Instant Heart Rate Free. Azumio Support

This version seems to fix a wildly inaccurate pulse count the previous version had, however that's core functionality for the application and it never, ever should have been released with broken core functionality. this is so inaccurate I had my phone on a table and it started and recorded and was showing as if a person had their finger on the thing. Therefore don't give your doctor this information this app will create stress for those and cause a spike in heart rate.
App highly inaccurate Measured heart rate consistently low i.e. l low 40's when in reality my heart rate is 50 to 60 Consistemtly flags arrhythmia when I am in regular sinus rhythm Have deleted

I have anxiety and I take medicine. I downloaded this app and I took the test for 3 times first 2 s results that I have a heart arrhythmia condition. And the last test I did came out all green dots. I was okay ! No heart condition. This app is not like a hospital EKG. Not accurate. In this app my heart rate or pulse was showing a little high 81. I did compare with my blood pressure cuff machine is showing 65 in pulse. So please everyone don't get scared that your heart is not working properly..
Have to watch ads to get rewards before you can run a test
Iffy results at best, and if you have a bright led on your camera you may just burn yourself.

Heart rate is often doubled by the app and so far claims that everyone has an arrhythmia which can cause the average person a scare. Having to watch an add for the precision result is also an annoyance as it's required to get a real reading. The paid version is not worth the price whatsoever.
Inconsistent results. Difficult to use. Feeling the pulse by hand in the side of my neck is enough to tell me that the results coming out of this are all over the place and not accurate.
Dangerously inaccurate If your looking for some reassurance after having chest pain, go to the hospital, dont go on this app, it will cause you more anxiety as its dreadful.
Inaccurate garbage. Reading from 60 to 200 in couple of seconds. Full of ads. Not recommended.

So, so bad. 1st test everything was in the green, heart rate was 77. Ran it again, a rythmia and tachardia, pulse 111. Ran again, same t and a, pulse 155... All while lying in bed. Pulse rate was about 62... Uninstalled.
Im in hospital getting a checkup after using this app. My heart is fine, i ised the app again and it still tells me my heart has a problem. This is a terrible app.
Thanks to this app we were able to get a heart measurement for our floor. Poor thing. We had no idea it was suffering from an undiagnosed heart condition.
Not reliable. Went to the ER last night and the ER doctor compared this app to the hospital heart monitor. This app is not accurate.
It made my finger get really hot, which hurt! The heart monitor on my phone has never done that before. It didn't even tell me anything about my heart, either.
Dysfunctional right out of the gate.
Doesn't work because no ads!!!
Nothing more than a random number generator that asks for too many permissions. Literally left it on the table without any part of me on it and it gave me 3 drastically different reads.
Purposely does not work - requires the user to "pay" for functions by watching ads. Requires permissions beyond the scope of the advertised app to finish loading.
Had a numbness so gave this a shot. Told me I had bad things went to Dr and was fine. Garbage app. Have some couth your swindler.

Sorry....You dont need to access all my files nor record audio to measure my heartrate. I get you need access to the camera to use the pulse mo itor incorporated in it but that doesnt mean you need access to any other files on my phone. Uninstalled.

This app is very misleading. I took the test which told me I had to go to a hospital immediately. I got very panicked and visited my local A&E where I had an ECG and blood tests. All the tests came back clear. Forget all these apps people. Listen to your Drs advice. I wouldn't even give this a one star.
So I guess I must be dead my heart rate is 41 according to this app. My actually heart rate is 84.
Completely inaccurate. Probably causes more heart problems, just by scaring people with false readings.

Do not use, it panicked me so rechecked immediately with what I'd expect to a very high rate due to my shock to go down to 51bpm and a further 3 times each time with radically different figures. It would have been funny if it hadn't worried me so much.

i downloaded this because I'm experiencing palpitations and wanted to see if there was something going on. And sure enough, the app said there is - keeps flashing the arrhythmia warning at me, and my heart rate fluctuates wildly.  However, it also does this when I don't put my finger to the camera at all. So it's giving false readings, and probably causing more harm than good in many many cases.  DO NOT TRUST IT
Absolutely garbage, I paid for the no ads one. I do have afib. But, I laid the phone down without stopping it says my counter was having heart problems. Proves to me its trash. Uninstalling.
Compared it to hospital ekg and heart rate monitor while I was in the emergency room and it was incredibly inaccurate.

This app is garbage. i used it on my Galaxy S9+ and it gave wildly different heart rates from one test to the next while doing multiple tests consecutively. The range was between 60 and 128 while sitting at rest. I use the Samsung app and it gives a consistant reading. Also if i listened to what it says i should be in the hospital or dead by now. Here i am.

Condition "DANGER" came up almost every time (about 10 readings)but for different reasons, most often afib but also bradycardia and tachycardia together & individually. This app contradicts consistent readings on my home bp/afib/Hr unit and another app showing similar typical (for me) readings. I purchased the paid version but refunded it when i got the discrepancies. I kept the free version to test but get the same false alarms. this was on a Samsung S7.

Wildly inaccurate. 1st reading said my bpm were 92. Switched over to Samsung health immediately and heart rate was actually at 75. Tried several more times, 3rd reading said I was at 116 bpm. Then I tried a reading not placing my finger on the camera. It still gave a reading. Look elsewhere for accuracy. This does not work, and gave me even more anxiety.

Designed to force ad revenue which is fine. However, the developers are putting people's lives in danger. People really believe it's working and it's just silly. "oh hey, I'm having heart palpitations but let me watch this 30 second ad before I can take a detailed measurement!" Add revenue is the only thing that actually works on this app.

This is a farce. I think it just randomized results with no relationship to YOUR situation. It gives me consistent readings of abnormal arrhythmia and rapid heart rate. In one case showing a reading of 120 bpm. Checked that with Samsungs app and it was only 66 - 68 bpm, with was accurate according to physical pulse check. My initial response was deep concern, so I had an EKG done which the doc said was pristine - absolutely NO sign of abnormalities. Conclusion: uninstall this app.
Have to watch ads to use and when I used it the light sensor burnt my finger and my phone got super hot

It wasn't accurate. I did several tests and all of them came back that I had a heart condition. I had a few others test it with me and they all got the same results. it showed my heartbeat in the 100s, but when compared with a actual medcial device my heartbeat rate was in the 60s.

rubbish. no app can realiably tell your heart rate and rythem using only your phone camera. i had this app telling me i had all sorts wrong with my heart one reading and then fine the next. my pulse has always felt fine and i had an ecg at the doctors today too which had no issues. They should make this clear that these kinds of apps that use a camera can be wildly inaccurate and save the worry people might get from using this. very irresponsible.

Negative infinity stars. I am curently having an odd heart beat and am siting alone. I tried to download and use this to see what is wrong and it tells me I don't have enough reward points. I hope the app developer rots alive in a pile of feaceas. And when they die I hope there is a hell and I get to meet them there. I will have fun with you, you greedy little peace of.............

this app is really inaccurate. I can get two completely different readings from one minute to the next. my Google heart rate measurement is much more accurate when compared to control, ie taking my pulse manually or with the blood pressure machine. I do not recommend this app at all.

Horrible. Inaccurate and you have to pave your finger on your camera lens with the flash on, tends to get hot too. Not at all what I thought. And it said I had tachycardia with hr at 114 bpm, when I checked myself, I'm as t 74 bpm. This app sucks, I'm sorry.

Consistently different readings. One reading my heart is perfect and the next i'm dying. Heart rate was compared to an actual heart rate monitor and was way off. If you have health anxiety do not use this app, it will induce a panic attack.
Low quality, heavy ads. Not very useful.

One star till someone explains why it says the floor or table has a heart beat and a dangerous arrhythmia... then keeps telling me I have a dangerous heart arrhythmia as well... when running a real time scan it keeps flashing from normal to danger on all the categories continuously... light will burn the heck out of your finger before the reading is finished as well.. App tested on Samsung Note 9.

Dont believe it!! Not accurate. give false readings. Told me I had an arrhythmia and was in danger. 2014: Le pubblicit√† le carica benissimo a tutto schermo, lo streaming della diretta in compenso salta continuamente anche su wifi e l'applicazione non funziona in background. Completamente inutile al momento. 2017: tutto come sopra, ma almeno adesso resta in background...

Lo streaming si blocca sempre in background, quindi √® impossibile usarla ad esempio per ascoltare la radio in macchina senza dover guardare il cellulare. Per il resto l'app serve a poco: √® la radio che conta!

La riproduzione dello streaming si blocca di continuo, sia sotto connessione WiFi che LTE. Per farla ripartire bisogna chiudere l'applicazione e riaprirla. Questo ogni 5 minuti. √à alquanto snervante ed inutile

Best wishes, your radio.net Team

Reply Content: Hi! It is possible to manage favorites without an account, so we have removed the (no longer needed) login function. Just syncing on multiple devices is not possible - sorry for that. The settings screen is available via the user avatar on the top left. For further questions please contact contact@radio.net. Best regards, team radio.net.

Review Content: Locks up every time I use it after a random period of time, without fail. I've finally given up and uninstalled.
Reply Content: Hi Jim, thanks for your honest feedback! Please re-install your app. Please mind that all favorites that were saved without being logged in will be deleted. The stations that you saved while being logged in will remain on your account. It may also help to switch off your phone and restart it. If that doesn't solve it email us at contact@radio.net

Reply Content: Hey Melvin, thanks for the feedback! Please check that your internet connection is constant and stable. In your app settings you can raise your buffer time to improve playback. If the problem continues please reinstall the app. If these tips don't help please email us at contact@radio.net, your radio.net Team

Review Content: ÿ®⁄©Ÿàÿßÿ≥ ÿß€åŸæŸÑ€å⁄©€åÿ¥ŸÜ €Å€í ŸàŸÇÿ™ ÿ∂ÿßÿ¶ÿπ ⁄©ÿ±ŸÜ€í ⁄©€í ŸÑ€å€í €Å€í

I try this app every 3-4 months or so to see if it works any better. Sadly, it never does. The Chromebook icon appears only after you select a stream, and I get anywhere from 1-4 tracks before the stream stops working. Sometimes it can be restarted but sometimes the effort is greater than the reward. I really want to like what CBC does. That's getting harder and harder. Sigh.....
Reply Content: We want to help, Harvey! Please send us a note and screen shots via the Contact Us form in the User Settings of the app?

Review Content: This app is seriously using background battery power when not even in use! Here is a typical scenario: 1) reboot phone completely 2) charge phone to 100% 3) no apps are now running in background 4) do not use or even load up "CBC Listen" for 24 hours 5) check battery use - CBC Listen has consumed 9% of my battery over 24 hours without even being used or loaded. Unless this fault is fixed I am removing this app for good. I cannot recommend this app for anyone, even though it is quite good otherwise it has serious background CPU usage faults.
Reply Content: Hi Larry. We are really sorry for the trouble and we appreciate you bringing this issue to our attention. We will look into this further!

Review Content: WAS IMPRESSED to have access to 2 Special Radio Programs! WHEN finished, I recieved a notice on my screen to turn off apps using camera; in order to connect TO camera. It would seem that " this holds my camera from my own use" ? I will have remove it for ONLY THAT reason üö© It would have earned a 5 if this did not arise.
Reply Content: Hi Anna. Rest-assured, the permission request is to enable sending downloadable podcasts to your device.Consider this a one-way action: CBC Listen can only send downloaded content to your device by your choosing; it cannot retrieve contacts, files or other content from your device. To learn more, please visit: Personal Information & Privacy Act.

Review Content: It's a nightmare trying to find the show you want and when you do it times out and you can't play it anyway. The old version was way better. This is almost unusable now..
Reply Content: Hi Sean. We're continuously making improvements to the CBC Listen app experience with the goal to serve you better. We'd like to invite you to participate in reshaping future versions of the app to help more listeners find what they're looking for. Is this something you'd be interested in? If so, please contact Sam at cbclisten@cbc.ca

Review Content: I have uninstalled it twice. Shut my phone down numerous times but I cannot get the on demand content to play. "Something keeps going wrong "
Reply Content: Hi Ted. Apologies for the inconvenience and thank you for sharing your feedback! We have since resolved this issue. You should now be able to play On Demand content again. No need to update your app. Please give it a try now? We hope you find this helpful and give us another chance!

Review Content: Very difficult to navigate. Why can't I search across silos? Tonight I've given up playing an archived program I know is there because I can't navigate to it.
Reply Content: That doesn't sound right, Andrew! We want to help. Please send us a note and screen shots via the Contact Us form in the User Settings of the app.

Review Content: Same sentiment as everyone else...this app is awful. Nothing loads when searching and I can't even find the basic programming I want. World Report should not be hard to find. The previous version of the app was so absolutely superior to this, the creator of the "new" design should be out of a job for being so out of touch. Figure it out CBC.
Reply Content: We're sorry this is frustrating. In the On Demand, CBC Podcasts & Music Playlists sections, you can search by tapping "Search Shows" (previously-aired such as World Report), "Search Podcasts", "Search Playlists" (by genre). Hope that helps! We aim to improve the search feature so it's more obvious in future releases. Thank you for your feedback!

Review Content: Awful. Streaming pauses every 7 to 10 minutes. I have to wake up my phone for stream to begin again. I've tried every setting and troubleshooting trick on my Samsung 9. It is only this terrible app. I miss cbc music :-( it has been too annoying to listen to since CBC changed to this app. Attempts to contact cbc about the issue have never been responded to....
Reply Content: That doesn't sound right! We are really sorry for the trouble and we appreciate you bringing this issue to our attention. We will look into this further and hope you give us another chance.

Review Content: Unreliable. You could create a game around when the stream will stop. It's like roulette. Impossible to enjoy anything when you're constantly having to surveil the app.
Reply Content: We are really sorry for the trouble and we appreciate you bringing this issue to our attention. We are listening and are looking into this!

Review Content: Simple. It stops streaming all the time. My other streaming apps don't have a problem.
Reply Content: We are really sorry for the trouble and we appreciate you bringing this issue to our attention. We will look into this further!

Review Content: I can't figure out how to download podcasts! When I find one I want to download, my options are Play and Segments.
Reply Content: Sorry this is so frustrating. Due to our current rights management agreement, we're unable to release certain shows for offline listening. CBC Podcasts are still available for download/offline listening. Please know, we do aim to have more On Demand content available for download again very soon. We hear you and hope you give us another chance!

Review Content: Continually stalls and cuts out so I have to go to the phone and turn it back on. Frustrating!
Reply Content: Sorry for the trouble, Suzanne! We'll look into this and hope you give us another chance. Your feedback is important to us.

Review Content: Takes lots of data and I usually get notification.

Update: the app doesn't work anymore at all!! Whoever developed it, did a very poor job at it. Very disappointed, but more importantly, I can't listen to CBC anymore. And I'm sure I'm not alone. The search function is hidden under on demand now. It previously was my main gateway to find what I wanted. Some user experience testing would have helped before launching
Reply Content: We apologize for your bad experience. Could you please update the application. The older version has some issues that we have fixed. If you still face any issues, please contact us at cbclisten@cbc.ca.

Review Content: I'm still holding on to this disappointing app because I understand -or want to believe -developers may be trying to improve it. At this point, I find it as frustrating as when it was suddenly changed from the previous version which was easy to use and READ for my aging eyes. If I wish to hear previous episodes I literally need a magnifying lens to find the one I want. Among other complaints I resent the large square "facebook invite" on top of each program list. I'd rate this app half a star.
Reply Content: Sorry to hear you are unsatisfied with the progress of the updates. I hope you can enjoy our app again in the future.

Review Content: Please bring back the old app...I use this app a lot and 2-3 times a day it just stops...I look at my phone and it's like someone hit the stop button...any chance this app could work like the previous one? **update** 3 weeks has gone by and the app is as horrible as ever. **update Dec 2** The App now decides to start playing by itself. Phone was sitting on a table next to my chair and all of a sudden just started playing CBC. I will now drop my rating to 1 star.
Reply Content: We understand how annoying that must be. We're working on a solution. We hope you'll re-consider the rating once we fix the issue.

Review Content: Seems the developer decided to only design the interface for portrait oriented screens so on my Android TV box connected to my entertainment system, the graphics are 3 screen fulls, making the app difficult to navigate. Not difficult to implement landscape screen scaling! On the plus side there is more content. Too bad it is negated by connectivity issues and difficulty in navigating. You would think that this app would have been an upgrade from the Radio App, sadly it isn't.
Reply Content: Thank you for sharing your experience. Your feedback is important to us and helps us find ways to improve. Tell us more? cbclisten@cbc.ca

Review Content: I can't seem to figure out how to load shows and podcasts etc. onto CBC Listen. I've tried three or four times now and have gotten more and more frustrated especially since I hear the ads for how easy it is to use. Is there any tutorial out there? What am I missing? Long time CBC listener - Nancy
Reply Content: Sorry this is so frustrating! Podcasts are available for download using the downward arrow icon. But, due to our current rights management agreement, we're unable to release certain shows for offline listening. We aim to have On Demand available for offline again very soon. Meantime, you should be able to download your favourite CBC Podcasts.

Review Content: I used to love previous version where I could download podcasts (like Current, As it Happens) and listen to them in my commute. Now, unless i get unlimited data plan, i can't listen to any good programs. I do not understand why CBC would remove a good option of downloading podcasts?
Reply Content: We're sorry this is so frustrating, Kashif! Due to our current rights management agreement, we are unable to release certain shows for offline listening via the app. We do aim to have more On Demand content available for offline listening again very soon. We are listening and aim to improve the your experience. Thank you.

Review Content: Very frustrating to use, not at all intuitive. Spent half and hour trying to find Reclaimed and eventually gave up.
Reply Content: Sorry this is so frustrating. Within the On Demand, CBC Podcasts and Music Playlists sections, you can search by tapping "Search Shows" (previously-aired, like Reclaimed)  or "Search Podcasts" or "Search Playlists" (by genre). Hope that helps! We aim to improve the search feature so it's more obvious in future releases. Thanks for your feedback!

Review Content: Update Dec 24: No change. Constantly stops playing the playlist, rendering it pretty much useless. What was that song I heard a few minutes ago?- No idea, sadly. Also, can't Chromecast from my iPad (I have multiple devices). Love idea of the app, and it has potential.
Reply Content: We are really sorry for the trouble and we appreciate you bringing these issues to our attention. We will look into this further!

Review Content: I used the old app, which was easy to navigate and use, this app is over complicated and I use a podcast app to listen to shows instead. Just go back to your old platform instead of always overcomplicating things. All CBC web presence is sub par, at best.

Review Content: It doesn't work! Can use listen live, but nothing else. Cannot use the on demand feature. Got a new phone recently. Old phone had a similar app that worked fine. That app has been replaced by something that is clearly untested. Shame on you CBC!

Review Content: To protect my privacy, I turn off location tracking, but to use this app, I have to turn it on. I don't want _other_ apps tracking my location while listening to the CBC. CBC, please remove this restriction!

Review Content: Terrible! What was wrong with the cbc music app.? Why does this new app. need my gps location? Deny. why does it need to access my photos? Deny! If it's not broke don't fix it. Very disappointing.

Review Content: The update is horrible. Stops for no reason. Can't download shows. Can't rewind or skip ahead. Update didn't save any of my preferences. Very buggy. Seems like it was developed by some high school students, except they would have sone better. Wish I could give it zero stars. Come on CBC! Great programs. Awful app. Almost 2 months later--still horrible. Problems are still un-resolved. I just deleted the app. I'll find my CBC content elsewhere.
Reply Content: We apologize for your bad experience. Could you please update the application. The older version has some issues that we have fixed. If you still face any issues, please contact us at cbclisten@cbc.ca.

Review Content: Very confusing UI, with no obvious way to get to favourites once I'd selected a few. The search is dominated by large icons and tiny type: come on CBC, this is audio, so why would I associate a show with a picture? A list view with sortable columns or filters would be much more useful than having to scroll through 137 mostly meaningless pictures. I gave up on it after half an hour. Very disappointing considering the frequent references to it on shows I enjoy.

A while ago, I woke up to a very unfriendly app taking over my previously beloved CBC Radio. The previous version of CBC was so easy to use even for my visual problems. I found the new version so user unfriendly I went practically into a kind of "mourning" so to speak. After trying it a while, I gave up and uninstalled it, but I had a faint hope it might be a trial version with an option to get back to the previous one. I see it's here to stay. Good bye then. I agree with the poor ratings.
Reply Content: Hi, we are always looking to improve the experience for our users, and really appreciate the feedback. If there is anything specific we can look into, please contact us at cbclisten@cbc.ca.

Review Content: It crashes regularly, and it is miserably designed for accessibility (visually impaired). Nothing is intuitive, everything is difficult to find, and the font can't easily be enlarged. Everything used to be wonderful with the CBC Radio App. I am likely going to abandon this Listen app and find my shows on the website as they are much easier to navigate. How bad must an app be that it is much worse than taking the time to look up a website?
Reply Content: We are really sorry for the trouble and we appreciate you bringing this issue to our attention. We will look into this further!

Review Content: Really disappointed that the music play lists are gone from the CBC Music App. I know they are available on this new app, CBC Listen but I can't download it. Unless a person has a really new device it is not compatible. Wanted to listen to seasonal music over the holidays and can't. I have three different devices and all are apparently incompatible with this new app. I live in rural BC and have really no options for music anymore. I think that is really sad that BBC can't make an app that is available and compatible with a wide range of devices for everyone.
Reply Content: We're sorry this is so frustrating! Due to our current rights management agreement, we are unable to offer downloadable Music Playlists. Would you let us know which devices and operating systems you are using? We'd like to see what we can do to help. Please email us at cbclisten@cbc.ca

Review Content: Where is the Alarm clock feature. I can't seem to find it anywhere.

Lock screen widget broken. Missing dark theme. Clunkier than CBC radio app. Images take up WAY too much space. It's like a marketing ad. Needs to be a list view of items. I use the app to listen to CBC, not see huge useless photoshoots of the show. That said, the font sizes are WAY too small, which is the information I want to see. Very annoying.
Reply Content: We are really sorry for the trouble and we appreciate you bringing these issues to our attention. We will look into this further!

Review Content: Shitiest radio app ever cant just go to app to hear latest news. Just Spent the last 15 minutes to listen to Terry O riley. Never reached it but listened and watched 4 commercials about CBC relevi sion programming what misery that was. I wish Harper was still here and he cut 100% of your funding. You are a blight on my television ,radio and specially on the internet. Please die

Review Content: Been a CBC listener for a long time. The new app wants permmission to access my location. Apparently this is to know if you are in Canada. This is not required as my IP address and or meta data already gives you my "general location". Yes or No? CBC wants to know "where" you listen....at work...while driving...at home...etc. Simply put this is an invasion of privacy. DATA Collection. No Thanks. If it was not required to listen to streaming music before why now? PS. APP Redesign is a fail.

Review Content: Super big CBC listener, and was really hoping that this app would allow me full access in one app. First it would not install or move to my SD card, thereby eating up substantial memory on my internal capacity, then the permissions to access location, thus eating up battery and invading privacy, and then photos etc, thus invading privacy again (why????) Prompted an immediate uninstall. What a fail! No thanks, no access Why does it need to be installed on internal memory???
Reply Content: Sorry for the frustration, Chris! The purpose of the app asking for this permission is to enable the app to send downloadable podcasts to your device. The app cannot retrieve files. Also rest-assured, we don't carry or hold granular location data. We receive city-level location data to deliver radio streams and recently aired shows in your area.

For music channels, casting is hidden on the album page and finally having found it I couldn't get it to send anything to the TV but a splash screen.
